alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:33AM CDT until June 17 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN MONROE...NORTHWESTERN RANDOLPH...SOUTHERN JEFFERSON... NORTHWESTERN STE. GENEVIEVE...NORTHERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN ST. FRANCOIS COUNTIES... At 533 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Valmeyer to near Richwoods, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... De Soto, Red Bud, Olympian Village, Evansville, Baldwin, Bloomsdale and Rocky Ridge. This also includes Washington State Park and St. Francois State Park. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 154 and 178. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
